EnglishScore: All students from non-English speaking countries must provide proof of English proficiency. This can be met by providing one of the following: TOEFL: 61 iBT, IELTS: 6.0, PTE Academic: 50, Duolingo English Test: 95, ELS: Completion of level 112, or successful completion of an associate, bachelor's, master's, or doctoral degree from a regionally accredited college or university in the U.S.
Requirements: Completed online graduate application, Bachelor's degree from an accredited institution, Official transcripts from all institutions attended, Minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA for full acceptance, Two letters of recommendation, Statement of purpose, Copy of teaching license (if applicable).
Concentration: Curriculum and Teaching, Educational Administration, Human Resource Development, Mathematics, Science, STEAM
Description: Whether you are looking for professional development or a career change, The University of Findlay's Master of Arts in Education (MAE) program can help you meet your goals. We offer a variety of emphases and license options to help you advance your career. The MAE program is designed to fit your busy schedule with courses offered online, on campus and in hybrid formats.
Accredidation: Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP)

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Professional Communication
EnglishScore: Official scores from the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), Pearson Test of English Academic (PTE) or Duolingo English Test (DET) are required if your native language is not English.
Requirements: Completed online graduate application; Official transcripts from all institutions attended sent directly to the University of Findlay, Office of Admissions; GPA of 3.0 or higher; Two letters of recommendation; A current résumé or curriculum vitae; A statement of purpose; A writing sample
Department: College of Arts, Humanities, and Social Sciences
Description: The Master of Arts in Professional Communication (MAPC) prepares students for success in a wide variety of professions. The program is designed to develop the student's ability to communicate effectively using oral, written, and visual modes. The MAPC provides a strong foundation in theory and practice, ensuring that students are well-versed in the latest communication strategies and technologies. This program is available 100% online or on campus.

ProgramName: Master of Arts in Rhetoric and Writing
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English are required to take the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), the International English Language Testing System (IELTS), Pearson Test of English Academic (PTE) or the Duolingo English test and submit their scores directly to The University of Findlay.
Requirements: Completed online application; Official transcripts from all institutions attended; Overall undergraduate GPA of 3.0 or higher; A current résumé or curriculum vitae that demonstrates relevant professional experience; A formal academic writing sample of at least five pages (e.g., a paper from a previous undergraduate or graduate course); A 500-700-word statement of purpose describing your educational and professional goals and how the Master of Arts in Rhetoric and Writing will help you achieve those goals; Two letters of recommendation from professional or academic references (sent directly from the reference).
Department: College of Arts, Humanities, and Social Sciences
Description: Findlay's Master of Arts in Rhetoric and Writing (MARW) offers a customized curriculum to meet your personal and professional goals. Whether you are looking to teach dual enrollment, move into a doctoral program, or advance your career in the private sector, our program will give you the skills you need to succeed.
ScholarshipAmount: Full-tuition waiver and a $7,500 stipend for graduate assistantships.

ProgramName: Master of Arts in TESOL and Applied Linguistics
EnglishScore: For international students, a minimum TOEFL score of 79 on the IBT, 6.5 on the IELTS or an ELS level 112 certificate.
Requirements: Completed online graduate application. Official transcripts from all institutions attended. A grade point average of 3.0 or higher. A bachelor's degree from an accredited institution. Two letters of recommendation. A one-page statement of purpose explaining your interests in TESOL and Applied Linguistics and your career goals. A resume or curriculum vitae. Students for whom English is not their first language must submit a TOEFL score of 79 (iBT), an IELTS score of 6.5, or a Duolingo score of 105.
Department: College of Arts, Humanities, and Social Sciences
Description: The Master of Arts in TESOL and Applied Linguistics program prepares you to be a specialist in second language teaching and linguistics. Our coursework provides a solid foundation in the theory and practice of teaching English to speakers of other languages.

EnglishScore: Proof of English proficiency: TOEFL, IELTS, PTE, Duolingo, SAT, ACT, successful completion of the University's Intensive English Language Program (IELP), or other proof of proficiency approved by the University.
Requirements: To be considered for admission into the Master of Business Administration program, you must have: A completed online application. A baccalaureate degree from an accredited institution. Official transcripts from all institutions attended sent directly to the University of Findlay's Office of Admissions. A cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher is required.* One letter of recommendation. Current resume. A personal statement outlining your professional goals and how the University of Findlay’s MBA can help you achieve them. *Applicants with a GPA between 2.5 and 2.99 can be conditionally admitted.
Concentration: Certified Management Accountant; Certified Public Accountant; Finance; Healthcare Management; Human Resource Management; International Business; Marketing; Operations Management
Description: The Master of Business Administration (MBA) is designed to equip the student with skills that can be directly applied in the workplace. The program features an emphasis on ethical leadership and a strategic focus. Students have the option to customize their degree by choosing a concentration.
Accredidation: Accreditation Council for Business Schools and Programs (ACBSP)
ScholarshipType: Graduate Assistantships, Alumni Discounts, Endowed Scholarships

EnglishScore: Graduate applicants must demonstrate English language proficiency in one of the following ways: TOEFL, IELTS, PTE, ELS, Duolingo, or completion of UF's IELP program.
Requirements:
To be considered for admission, applicants must submit the following items to the Occupational Therapy Centralized Application Service (OTCAS). Apply here: https://portal.otcas.org/.

Minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0
Minimum prerequisite GPA of 3.0
No prerequisite course grade can be less than a “C”
Prerequisite courses must be completed within seven years of matriculation into the OT program
Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions
Three letters of recommendation
Minimum of 40 observation hours are required in at least two diverse practice settings; a minimum of 20 hours in each setting. Hours must be verified by an OTR or COTA.
Personal statement addressing why you selected OT as a career and how an OT degree relates to your immediate and long-term professional goals. Describe how your personal, educational, and professional background will help you achieve your goals.
Description: University of Findlay’s Master of Occupational Therapy (MOT) Program is a professional entry-level degree program for students who have completed a bachelor’s degree (in any major) and have completed the program prerequisites. Occupational therapists help people of all ages do the things they want and need to do through the therapeutic use of daily activities (occupations). Common occupational therapy interventions include helping children with disabilities to participate fully in school and social situations, helping people recovering from injury to regain skills, and providing supports for older adults experiencing physical and cognitive changes.
Accredidation: The occupational therapy program is accredited by the Accreditation Council for Occupational Therapy Education (ACOTE) of the American Occupational Therapy Association (AOTA).
ScholarshipType: Endowed scholarships (may be based on academic merit and/or financial need)

Requirements:
Application must be submitted through the Centralized Application Service for Physician Assistants (CASPA).

Application Requirements:
- Baccalaureate degree from a regionally accredited U.S. institution
- All prerequisite courses must be completed at a regionally accredited U.S. institution with a C or better.
- Overall GPA of 3.0 or higher (on a 4.0 scale).
- Overall science GPA of 3.0 or higher (on a 4.0 scale).
- Prerequisite GPA of 3.0 or higher (on a 4.0 scale).
- The GRE is no longer required for admission.
- Technical Standards acknowledgment is required.
- A minimum of 500 hours of direct patient care experience is required.
- Two letters of reference.
- CASPer test score submission.
- Applicants must be U.S. citizens or permanent residents.
Description: The University of Findlay's Physician Assistant Program is committed to providing a supportive, collaborative, and professional environment for students to gain the medical knowledge, skills, and values needed to become competent and compassionate physician assistants.
Accredidation: The Accreditation Review Commission on Education for the Physician Assistant, Inc. (ARC-PA) has granted Accreditation-Continued status to the University of Findlay Physician Assistant Program.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Applied Security and Analytics
EnglishScore: International Students must submit proof of English proficiency. Accepted tests and scores are: TOEFL with a minimum score of 550 (PBT), 213 (CBT), or 79-80 (IBT); IELTS with a minimum score of 6.5; Pearson Test of English (PTE) with a minimum score of 58; Duolingo with a minimum score of 105; or successful completion of Level 112 at an ELS Language Center. Students who are citizens of a country where English is the official language or have earned a bachelor's degree from an accredited American institution are exempt.
Requirements: Completed online graduate application; Bachelor's degree from an accredited institution; Official transcripts from all institutions attended; Overall undergraduate GPA of 3.0; Resume; Statement of Purpose: A one-page personal statement describing your professional goals and why you are choosing this program; One of the following: 1. Hold an undergraduate degree in computer science with an overall GPA of 3.0 or higher from a U.S. regionally accredited institution. 2. Pass the GRE with a quantitative score of 155 or higher, a verbal score of 150 or higher, and an analytical writing score of 4.0 or higher. 3. Pass the MSASA challenge exam. 4. Complete, with a grade of B or higher, the following University of Findlay courses: CSCI 501 and CSCI 502.
Description: With the University of Findlay’s Master of Science in Applied Security and Analytics, you can become a leader in the rapidly growing fields of big data and cybersecurity. You can improve your credentials and gain the necessary skills to advance your career in the IT industry. This degree is designed to cover a unique blend of coursework in both cybersecurity and business analytics.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Environmental, Safety and Health Management
EnglishScore: The University of Findlay requires all students for whom English is not their native language to provide proof of English proficiency. This can be done by providing an official score report for one of the following: TOEFL: Minimum score of 550 on the paper-based test or 79-80 on the Internet-based test (iBT). IELTS: Minimum overall score of 6.5. PTE: Minimum score of 58. Duolingo: Minimum score of 110. ELS: Completion of Level 112 from an ELS Language Center in the U.S.
Requirements: Completed online application; Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution; Official transcripts from all institutions attended; Minimum undergraduate GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale (applicants with a GPA of at least 2.7 may be considered for conditional admission); Resume; A statement of purpose describing your professional goals and why you are interested in pursuing the master's degree at The University of Findlay.
Description: The Master of Science in Environmental, Safety and Health Management degree prepares you for leadership positions in the environmental industry. The program provides you with the skills to make managerial decisions and provides technical knowledge to help you work in the environmental, safety and health field. The University of Findlay's All Hazards Training Center, which has provided custom training to industry and government since 1989, provides the hands-on training for the program. The degree can be completed 100% online, on-campus or a convenient blend of both.
Accredidation: The Master of Science in Environmental, Safety and Health Management is accredited by the National Environmental Health Science and Protection Accreditation Council (EHAC).

ProgramName: Master of Science in Health Informatics
EnglishScore: All students for whom English is not their native language must submit proof of English proficiency. Findlay accepts the following: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL): 61 iBT, 500 PBT, International English Language Testing System (IELTS): 6.0, Pearson Test of English Academic (PTE): 50, Duolingo English Test: 95, ELS Language Centers: Completion of level 112.
Requirements: Complete the online application. Hold a bachelor's degree from an accredited institution. Possess a cumulative GPA of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scale or a 2.7-2.99 with three years of related work experience in healthcare or information technology. Submit official transcripts from all institutions attended. Submit a resume of professional experience. Submit a statement of purpose. Two recommendation forms from professional or academic references.
Description: Health informatics is the science of evaluating, implementing, and utilizing technology to manage health information to improve patient care. The Master of Science in Health Informatics (MSHI) program at the University of Findlay prepares students to step into a variety of roles within the healthcare industry. This program provides a solid foundation in the technology and management aspects of health informatics.

ProgramName: Master of Science in Radiologic Sciences
DeadlineDate: Aug. 1 for fall semester start and Dec. 1 for spring semester start
EnglishScore: Students for whom English is not their native language must submit proof of English proficiency by providing an official score from one of the following: TOEFL: 79 iBT, IELTS: 6.5, PTE Academic: 54, Duolingo English Test (DET): 110, or successful completion of ELS Language Center's Level 112.
Requirements: Completed online application; Official transcripts from all institutions attended (send to Findlay's admissions office); Minimum 3.0 GPA; Copy of American Registry of Radiologic Technologists (ARRT) certification and registration in Radiography (R), Nuclear Medicine (N), Sonography (S), or Radiation Therapy (T); Copy of state license (if applicable); Completed prerequisites (must be completed with a "C" or better): College algebra or higher math, English composition, Medical terminology; Resume/CV detailing professional work experience; Personal statement describing career goals; Three letters of recommendation.
Description: The Master of Science in Radiologic Sciences (MSRS) program prepares you for a career in leadership or higher education. This online program is designed for working professionals who are registered radiologic technologists and are ready to advance their careers.

EnglishScore: International students must provide proof of English language proficiency. Accepted tests and minimum scores are: TOEFL: 79 iBT, IELTS: 6.5, PTE: 58, Duolingo: 110, ELS: 112. Proof may also be satisfied by successful completion of an approved ESL program, specific English composition courses from a U.S. accredited institution, or if the applicant is a native of or has received a bachelor's degree from a designated English-speaking country.
Requirements:
Completed online graduate application
Official transcripts from all institutions attended; undergraduate and graduate
Master's degree from a regionally accredited institution
Minimum graduate GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale
Vita or resume outlining professional and educational experience
Personal statement addressing the question "Why a Doctorate in Education from The University of Findlay?"
Two letters of recommendation​
Successful interview with the Doctoral Admissions Committee
If an applicant's native language is not English and he/she has not graduated from an approved English-speaking university, then the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) is required.
Description: The University of Findlay's Doctor of Education (Ed.D.) program is designed to create leaders who have the knowledge and skills to transform educational organizations and improve student learning. We offer two distinct emphasis areas to match your career goals: School Psychology and Teaching and Learning. The Doctor of Education program is a conceptual framework designed around the domains of advocacy, stewardship, and leadership.
Accredidation: The College of Education is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).

ProgramName: Doctor of Education in School Psychology
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in psychology or related field from a regionally-accredited institution
Overall undergraduate grade point average of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scale
Psychology GPA of at least 3.25
Official transcripts from all colleges and universities attended
A current Curriculum Vita (CV) or resume
Three letters of recommendation
A one-page statement describing your career goals, how this degree will help you attain them, and your qualifications for this profession
A writing sample
Graduate Record Exam (GRE) is NOT required for admission to the Ed.D. in School Psychology program
A successful interview with program faculty
Description: The University of Findlay’s Doctor of Education in School Psychology program is designed to give you the knowledge and skills necessary to become a licensed school psychologist. This program is built on a practitioner-scholar model, emphasizing the application of research to practice.
Accredidation: The College of Education is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).

Requirements: The University of Findlay's OTD program is a participant in the Centralized Application Service for Occupational Therapy (OTCAS) for all applicants (including current UF students). A bachelor's degree from an accredited institution. Minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. Completion of all prerequisite courses with a grade of C or better. Prerequisite coursework must be completed within seven years prior to application. 20 hours of observation with an occupational therapist or occupational therapy assistant in a minimum of two different practice settings. The observation form is provided here. Three letters of recommendation submitted through OTCAS. On-campus interview by invitation only. Students for whom English is their second language must submit a TOEFL score of 89 with a 26 in speaking or higher.
Description: Occupational therapists help people of all ages to live active and productive lives. They help children with disabilities participate in school and social situations, assist those recovering from injuries to regain skills and aid older adults to remain independent. The Doctor of Occupational Therapy (OTD) Program at the University of Findlay is a professional entry-level degree program designed to prepare students to become occupational therapists.
Accredidation: The entry-level occupational therapy doctoral degree program is accredited by the Accreditation Council for Occupational Therapy Education (ACOTE) of the American Occupational Therapy Association (AOTA).

EnglishScore: In addition to the requirements listed above, international students must also submit: Official TOEFL or IELTS scores. TOEFL requirement: A minimum score of 550 on the paper-based test, 213 on the computer-based test, or 79 on the Internet-based test is required. IELTS requirement: A minimum overall band score of 6.5 is required. Students that do not meet the minimum TOEFL or IELTS score may be considered for conditional admission. Students who have successfully completed the University of Findlay's Intensive English Language Program are not required to take the TOEFL or IELTS.
Requirements: Completion of a baccalaureate degree from a regionally accredited institution prior to the start of the program. Minimum cumulative grade point average (GPA) of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. Minimum prerequisite science and math GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. Completion of all prerequisite courses with a grade of 'C' or better prior to the start of the program. Two letters of recommendation are required (one must be from a physical therapist). Observation hours - a minimum of 40 hours of observation in at least two different physical therapy practice settings is required. We require applicants to use the PTCAS platform to record observation hours. Graduate Record Exam (GRE) is not required. All students accepted into the University of Findlay's DPT program will be required to complete a background check and drug screen. All application materials must be submitted through PTCAS.
Description: Physical therapists are health care professionals who diagnose and treat individuals of all ages, from newborns to the elderly, who have medical problems or other health-related conditions that limit their abilities to move and perform functional activities in their daily lives. At the University of Findlay, you can complete your Doctor of Physical Therapy (DPT) degree through our Traditional Program or our Weekend PTA to DPT Bridge Program. We are proud to offer two options for students to complete their doctorate degree. Experiential learning is a key component to the Physical Therapy Program at the University of Findlay. Students participate in diverse clinical education experiences and service-learning opportunities involving pro bono clinics, advocacy, and community outreach.
Accredidation: The Doctor of Physical Therapy Program at the University of Findlay is accredited by the Commission on Accreditation in Physical Therapy Education (CAPTE), 3030 Potomac Ave., Suite 100, Alexandria, Virginia 22305-3085; telephone: 703-706-3245; email: accreditation@apta.org; website: http://www.capteonline.org.
ScholarshipType: Diversity in Physical Therapy Scholarship, Dr. Jane F. Miller Endowed Scholarship, The Ken and Ginnie L. Cole Endowed Scholarship, UF PT Student Scholarship

EnglishScore: International applicants must demonstrate proficiency in English. A minimum score is required for one of the following: Internet-based TOEFL (iBT) - minimum score of 79 with minimum sub-scores of 18, IELTS - minimum score of 6.5 with minimum sub-scores of 6.0, Duolingo - minimum score of 110, or successful completion of ELS level 112.
Requirements: To be considered for admission, applicants must complete the PharmCAS Application and submit official transcripts. A minimum cumulative GPA of 2.5 is required. PCAT scores are not required for admission. Two letters of recommendation are required to be submitted through PharmCAS. Applicants are required to complete all prerequisite coursework prior to matriculation. The College of Pharmacy requires a personal, on-campus interview. All applicants must be able to meet the technical standards of the pharmacy program.
Description: Pharmacists are medication experts and an integral part of the healthcare team. They are the most accessible healthcare provider and often the first source of assistance and advice on many common ailments and health care matters. Findlay's College of Pharmacy prepares you to be a confident, knowledgeable professional capable of meeting the challenges of the changing health care environment. The University of Findlay College of Pharmacy offers a 0-6 program. This means you can enter as a freshman and graduate with your Doctor of Pharmacy (Pharm.D.) in six years.
Accredidation: The University of Findlay’s Doctor of Pharmacy program is accredited by the Accreditation Council for Pharmacy Education.

EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must provide proof of English language proficiency. The University of Findlay accepts the following: TOEFL: A minimum score of 79 on the internet-based test (iBT). IELTS: A minimum score of 6.5. PTE: A minimum score of 54. Duolingo: A minimum score of 110. ELS: Level 112 completion.
Requirements: To be admitted to the Data Analytics Certificate program, the applicant must meet the following criteria: 1. A baccalaureate degree from a regionally accredited institution, or the international equivalent; 2. Completion of the Graduate application; 3. Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended.
Description: The Data Analytics Certificate consists of 12 semester hours of coursework. It is designed for students who want to have broad exposure to Big Data and data analytics. Students will learn how to handle, process, and analyze a large amount of data.
This 18-hour certificate prepares students to teach dual enrollment communication courses.

ProgramName: Dual Enrollment Certificate in Language Arts
Requirements: Bachelor's degree from an accredited institution. Meet one of the two following requirements: Have a graduate degree in the teaching discipline from an accredited institution; or Have completed at least 18 graduate credit hours in the teaching discipline from an accredited institution. A cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher from a completed baccalaureate degree program or a 3.0 or higher on all graduate coursework. Completed University of Findlay application. Official transcripts from all institutions attended.
Department: College of Arts, Humanities, and Social Sciences
Description: The University of Findlay’s Dual Enrollment Certificate program is designed for high school teachers who want to teach dual enrollment courses. This program provides the 18 graduate credit hours in the content area required by the Higher Learning Commission. Teachers can choose from the following content areas: Biology, Chemistry, English, History, Mathematics.

EnglishScore: International students are required to submit one of the following official test scores: TOEFL iBT: 79, IELTS: 6.5, PTE: 59, Duolingo: 110, or ELS: successful completion of level 112.
Requirements:
Completed online graduate application
A master's degree or higher from a regionally accredited institution
Official transcripts from all institutions attended, undergraduate and graduate
Description: The University of Findlay’s dual enrollment certificate is designed for high school teachers who want to teach dual enrollment courses. This certificate provides the 18 hours of graduate coursework in the specific content area required by the Higher Learning Commission.

Requirements: Bachelor’s degree from a regionally accredited institution, documented by an official transcript. A cumulative GPA of 2.75 or above. A resume listing work experience. A brief (1-2 page) statement of purpose detailing career goals and how this program will help achieve those goals. One letter of recommendation from an academic or professional source.
Description: This certificate prepares students to assume leadership roles in the public, non-profit and private sectors. The curriculum addresses the four phases of emergency management: mitigation, preparedness, response and recovery.

EnglishScore: Students for whom English is not their native language must submit one of the following as proof of English proficiency: TOEFL: 61 iBT, 500 PBT; IELTS: 6.0; PTE: 50; Duolingo: 95; ELS: successful completion of ELS level 112.
Requirements: Applicants must complete the online application for admission and submit official transcripts of all previous college coursework. No standardized graduate exam is required for admission.
Description: The Graduate Certificate in Environmental, Safety and Health Management is designed for professionals who want to advance their careers, but aren't ready to commit to a master's degree. The certificate consists of five courses (15 credit hours) and can be completed in as little as one year.

EnglishScore: International students must present evidence of English proficiency. This can be accomplished by meeting the minimum requirements for one of the following: TOEFL: 79 iBT; IELTS: 6.5; Duolingo: 115; PTE Academic: 58; Successful completion of the University of Findlay's Intensive English Language Program (IELP).
Requirements: The University of Findlay’s post-baccalaureate certificate in health informatics is intended for students who have completed a bachelor's degree. Students are encouraged to apply for admission to the health informatics certificate program if they meet the following criteria: Minimum 2.7 cumulative undergraduate GPA on a 4.0 scale​, Completed application form, Official transcripts from all institutions attended, Recommended coursework: one college-level math course, one college-level statistics course
Bachelor's degree from an accredited institution. Official transcripts from all institutions attended. A minimum 2.75 cumulative GPA for full acceptance. Current Teaching License.

ProgramName: Occupational Health and Safety Management Certificate
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must submit one of the following: TOEFL: 61 iBT, IELTS: 6.0, PTE: 50, Duolingo: 95, ELS: Completion of Level 112, or Successful completion of an associate, bachelor's, master's, or doctoral degree from a regionally accredited U.S. college or university.
Requirements:
Completed online application.
A minimum of a baccalaureate degree from an accredited institution.
Transcripts of all previous undergraduate and graduate work (if any).
A current résumé.
Statement of Purpose describing your career goals and reasons for pursuing the OH&S Management certificate at The University of Findlay.
No GRE requirement.
Description: The Certificate in Environmental, Safety and Health Management is designed for corporate and organizational managers who wish to develop or enhance their knowledge and skills in the area of environmental, safety and health management. This certificate consists of five courses (15 credit hours) that can be completed in as little as one year.

Requirements:
Bachelor's degree from an accredited institution
Official transcripts from all institutions attended
Overall GPA of 2.75
Completed graduate application
Description: University of Findlay’s Online Instruction Certificate Program is designed for P-12 teachers, higher education faculty, and corporate trainers who want to learn how to design and facilitate online courses. The program focuses on best practices in online teaching, instructional design, and assessment strategies.

Requirements: This certificate is specifically designed for practicing school counselors who hold a master’s degree and a current Ohio School Counselor license. To get started, simply apply to the University of Findlay as a non-degree seeking student.
Description: The University of Findlay's School Counselor Leadership program is designed for school counselors who want to be leaders in their field. This program leads to the School Counselor Leadership Endorsement. The program provides the skills necessary to advocate for student success, use data to drive program improvement, and lead comprehensive school counseling programs.
Accredidation: Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP)

Requirements: Completed online application, official transcripts from all colleges and universities attended, must have earned a bachelor's degree from an accredited institution, and must have a minimum undergraduate GPA of 2.75 on a 4.0 scale or a 3.0 on a 4.0 scale on last 60 hours of undergraduate coursework.
Description: With the growth of online learning, there is a distinct need for professionals to have a distinct skill set in how to design and deliver online instruction. This certificate provides students with the skills needed to design and deliver online instruction in a variety of settings.
